result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jacob A. Lee was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicles titled and registered in defendant's name is ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant must be in compliance with all rules, terms, and conditions of SSTOP program.
Defendant must be in compliance with drivers safety plan.
Defendant must be in full compliance at all times with DL and IID orders.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: 14 days to be served with 31 days I&S as defendant is eligible for SSTOP program. With huber for work and treatment if defendant qualifies under jail criteria. No objection to EM if eligible. Jail to begin in 14 days or at POs discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A. Lee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:44am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/pro se

State moves to:
Ct. 2 (Operate w/Restricted Controlled Substance 3rd)>>DISMISS
Ct. 3 (PAC 3rd)>>DISMISS
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self; a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 2 years Probation
CONDITIONS: Defendant must be in full compliance with all rules, terms and conditions of SSTOP program; $1379 inclusive; 45 days MCJ Total: 14 days to be served with 31 days I&S as Defendant is eligible for SSTOP Program, w/huber for work and treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, no objection to EM if eligible/available, and jail to begin within 14 days at PO's discretion; Defendant must be in full complinace with drivers safety plan; Defendant must be in full compliance at all times with the DL and IID orders; 24 month DL Rev w/credit; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself, both for a period of 24 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; AODA -- COURT deems completed.

Adj: 9:56am

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 10:12am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher; Defendant appears in person/pro se

Defendant is not prepeared to enter plea today - request to reset; COURT resets matter for plea 4/28/15  at 9:45

Adj: 10:16am
Plea hearing on April 28, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Defendant appeared in person; pro se - may be retaining Atty Dan Cveykus

Pre-trial conference on February 20, 2015 at 09:05 am.
Plea hearing on March 24, 2015 at 10:10 am.
Final pre-trial on April 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Jury Trial on May 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  No alcohol.   No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report Commencing 2-2-15.
Ltr dated 12/23/14 from Wausau Municipal Court
